Exaggerate: The claim of "coronavirus patients being cremated alive" is an exaggeration as there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that patients are being cremated alive.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that patients are being cremated alive based on a video and conspiracy theory, without concrete evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the Chinese government and World Health Organization that patients who die from the coronavirus are being swiftly cremated, but there is no evidence they are being cremated alive.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence to support the assertion of patients being cremated alive.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times as it consistently asserts the same belief throughout.
